item.title: Elden Ring Shows Off Jaw-Dropping New Armor for Shadow of the Erdtree DLC
item.description:
Highlights

  • Elden Ring's upcoming DLC will introduce new armor sets, characters, and quests on June 21 for players to enjoy.
  • The latest expansion, Shadow of the Erdtree, will feature a blond-haired character with intricately designed armor and an ornate sword.
  • Players can expect to encounter key figures like Messmer the Impaler and Miquella, adding depth and new storylines to the gameplay experience.

A new armor set that will appear in Elden Ring 's highly anticipated Shadow of the Erdtree DLC has just been revealed online. In addition to introducing new quests and characters, the expansion is expected to provide players with a host of new gear to use for their adventures across the Lands Between.

Shadow of the Erdtree , the first and final expansion of FromSoftware's critically acclaimed Elden Ring , is slated to be launched on June 21. It promises to immerse players in an all-new story set in the Land of Shadow that will feature new enemies and dungeons. The expansion will also add new weapons and equipment to the game, with one new set having already been unveiled even before the DLC was released.

4:32
Related
Elden Ring: 25 Best Strength Weapons, Ranked

Strength Weapons deal the heaviest damage of Elden Ring's arsenal, but some of these hard hitters rise above the rest.

In a post with the #ShadowoftheErdtree hashtag, the official Elden Ring Twitter account shared a photo of an unidentified blond-haired character donning an intricately designed armor set that was never included in the base game. The character also wielded an equally ornate sword that will most likely appear in the expansion as well. The gold and white armor set seemingly appeared in the recent story trailer for Shadow of the Erdtree as the wardrobe of one of the kneeling characters who showed up at the end.

New Armor Set in Elden Ring's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC

One Twitter user claimed that the armor was a reference to Dark Souls 2 , a title that is considered to be one of FromSoftware's hardest games to play . Others, meanwhile, speculated that the unnamed character could be Miquella, the brother of fellow demigod Malenia and the creator of Elden Ring 's brutal Haligtree dungeon. While Miquella was a background character in the base game, he will be the central figure of the expansion.

Another major character in Elden Ring 's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC will be Messmer the Impaler, a mysterious figure that has been prominently featured in the expansion's marketing. Messmer, who rivals other demigods, could be connected to Miquella's family or to the Golden Order that is prevalent in the Lands Between. They could also be related to Rykard, as both characters have snakes as part of their motifs.

Shadow will also be another important element of Messmer's design, FromSoftware president and Elden Ring director Hidetaka Miyazaki revealed in a February interview. Miyazaki added that players will discover why Messmer was never mentioned in the base game's lore and why he exists in Shadow of the Erdtree 's Land of Shadow .

item.title: Genshin Impact Making Big Change to Daily Resin Allowance
item.description:
Highlights

  • Genshin Impact is finally increasing its resin cap from 160 to 200, giving players more flexibility in gameplay activities.
  • Original Resin is crucial for obtaining rewards through various in-game activities but regenerates slowly, encouraging active engagement.
  • The higher resin cap is a welcome change that complements the game's recent quality-of-life updates, allowing players to approach activities like artifact farming differently.

After three and a half years, Genshin Impact is finally increasing its resin cap, as players will now be able to accumulate up to 200 Original Resin instead of 160. While Fontaine has famously brought several quality-of-life updates to Genshin Impact , players have long clamored for HoYoverse to increase the resin cap. Original Resin is a currency that players spend in order to obtain rewards from certain activities – taking out bosses, clearing out domains, or completing a Ley Line Outcrop. This currency passively regenerates at a speed of one Original Resin every eight minutes, and can even be stored in the form of a Condensed Resin for every 40 units that the player has.

However, given that the Traveler can only hold up to five Condensed Resins at any time, the system encourages players to frequently spend their resin by engaging with the game's repeatable content. Reaching the resin cap takes just a bit over 21 hours, which is why the argument for a higher resin limit in Genshin Impact has been so popular in the community.

Related
Genshin Impact Reveals 4.7 Quality-of-Life Changes

Genshin Impact gives all the details about quality-of-life changes that will be released in the version 4.7 update next month.

Genshin Impact Increasing Original Resin Limit to 200

Version 4.7 for Genshin Impact is expected to add three new characters, introduce the Imaginarium Theater, and raise the Original Resin cap from 160 to 200. The latter was announced on May 22 and will be explained in detail during the developer livestream on May 24. Though it remains to be seen if the new resin cap will also feature an overflow mechanic as seen in Honkai: Star Rail , it should allow Genshin Impact players to not lose any Original Resin if they happen to log in at roughly the same time every day.

While some Genshin Impact fans have mused that the release of Wuthering Waves could have inspired HoYoverse to finally raise the resin cap, it's certainly a welcome change that will give players more flexibility in how to approach activities such as artifact farming. Fontaine added the Crystalfly Trap, which made collecting Crystal Cores for Condensed Resin a trivial matter, and the new resin cap should (on paper) complement the quality-of-life feature well.

Though it remains to be seen what Natlan will bring to the table in Version 5.0 and beyond, the Fontaine patch cycle will likely be remembered for touching up on old features, as well as for streamlining the leveling process of artifacts and characters. Much like underwater content was the highlight in Fontaine, players can expect HoYoverse to place great emphasis on mounts in Natlan . Since players got their first impressions of Fontaine during the livestream for Version 3.7, there's a decent chance that Genshin Impact will give fans their first taste of Natlan on May 24.

item.title: Upcoming PlayStation Console Exclusive Could Have Its Big Reveal Within the Next 15 Days
item.description:
Highlights

  • Concord may finally receive a gameplay reveal by early June 2024.
  • Firewalk Studios' debut title has been in development since 2018 and is currently targeting a 2024 release.
  • The game was treated to a cinematic teaser at the May 2023 PlayStation Showcase, but no more official news has been shared ever since.

A Concord -related announcement is on the horizon, a reliable industry insider has said. According to their information, the upcoming PlayStation console exclusive may at last be treated to a gameplay reveal by early June.

Concord is a PvP shooter for the PS5 and PC that has been in development since 2018. It is the debut title from Firewalk Studios, a Bellevue, Washington-based company comprised of former Activision and Bungie staffers, among others. Its existence was first confirmed in April 2021, when PlayStation joined the project in a publisher capacity. Two years later, Sony acquired Firewalk for an undisclosed sum , which is at the very least assumed to be in the ballpark of the $250 million that the studio raised in a preferred Series A funding round in 2022. Concord has been treated to a 51-second video teaser at the May 2024 PlayStation Showcase, but there has been no official news about the game ever since.

6:45
Related
The 18 Best PS5 Exclusive Games, Ranked (May 2024)

A lot of the best PlayStation 5 exclusives are single-player experiences, with action-adventure and open-world also being frequently recurring themes.

Concord Gameplay Reveal May Arrive by June 7

That period of radio silence may finally be coming to an end, with Dealabs' Billbil-kun reporting that some kind of announcement, presumably one containing a gameplay reveal, is drawing near. Specifically, the industry insider estimates that more official Concord news will arrive within the next 15 days, so no later than June 7. While that happens to be the date when Summer Game Fest 2024 kicks off , Billbil-kun says they don't know whether Concord will actually be part of the next SGF lineup.

With the multiplayer shooter being a first-party game, it wouldn't be out of character for Sony to save its long-awaited gameplay reveal for one of its own events. The company recently hinted at a May 2024 PlayStation Showcase being in the works , but no such broadcast has been officially announced as of today, eight days before month's end.

Irrespective of its reveal venue, there is little doubt that Concord will be showcasing its gameplay in the near future. That's largely because the PlayStation console exclusive has just been reaffirmed for a 2024 release in mid-May. With the year almost being halfway over, Sony will need to reveal the game soon if it's to have any hope of running a successful marketing campaign.

Early hype will be particularly important for Concord in light of the fact that Firewalk's debut title is a live-service game, whose future will hence hinge on maintaining a healthy player community. Given the game's recently reaffirmed launch window, it's plausible that its gameplay reveal will also be accompanied by a release date.

item.title: Fortnite Festival Getting Important Update Soon
item.description:
Highlights

  • Fortnite Festival update on May 24 adds Pro Lead and Pro Bass modes for all controllers and keyboards.
  • Harmonix, creator of Rock Band series, developed Fortnite Festival mode with over 100 songs available.
  • New update allows players to keybind controls, introducing "HOPO" notes without the need for strumming.

Fortnite Festival is receiving an update very soon, which includes more options to play the Pro Lead or Pro Bass difficulty modes. Fortnite ’s Festival game mode was released in December, around the same time as Rocket Racing and LEGO Fortnite . The game mode is very similar to the Rock Band series, as players hit an arrangement of notes sliding along a track to licensed songs. Since its release, Fortnite Festival has amassed over 100 songs in it’s catalog.

Harmonix, the studio that created the Rock Band series, has been in charge of developing Fortnite Festival. Epic Games acquired Harmonix in November of 2021 and eventually ended support for its previous title, Rock Band 4 , in January. According to Harmonix CEO Alex Rigopolous, they aimed to create a free-to-play music game accessible to the millions of Fortnite players. The game mode has achieved critical success, with thousands of people playing every day.

Related
Fortnite Leak Reveals New Vehicle Coming in Chapter 5 Season 3

A new Fortnite vehicle is shown off in a leak that is expected to come to the game soon in Chapter 5 Season 3, launching May 24.

Coming in Chapter 5 Season 3 on May 24, Fortnite is adding additional options to access the Pro Lead or Pro Bass difficulty modes, which were previously locked to just guitar controllers. Fortnite Festival supports just a few existing plastic guitar controllers. These include the Rock Band 4 guitars and the new PDP Wireless guitar controller , with support for more on the way. Players without a supported guitar controller will now be able to play Pro Lead or Pro Bass on any console platform or PC.

Pro Bass and Pro Lead Modes Are Now Accessible to All Controllers and Keyboards

No matter which song part players select, there will be an option to see the notes as multi-colored gems, similar to how they appear when using the Pro Bass or Pro Lead modes. This update also adds support for non-pro parts for guitar controllers, like Vocals or Drums. The guitar controllers that are supported for these modes are still pretty costly, costing over $130 each.

Pro Lead and Pro Bass will now allow players to keybind their controls to their keyboard on PC. With new settings for fretting Green, Red, Blue, and Orange notes alongside an input for strumming, similar to how Rock Band works. Keyboard and mouse players will also have the ability to remap controllers to keyboards or accessibility devices to play the Pro Lead or Pro Bass song parts.

In Pro Lead or Pro Bass mode, players won't encounter the "Lift Notes," represented by an up arrow and activated by releasing a button press at the precise moment. Instead, players will come across "Hammer-Ons" and "Pull-Offs," known as "HOPO" notes. These "HOPO" notes have a distinct visual appearance from regular notes. To activate them during a combo, players simply need to press their note color keybind without the need for strumming. The mode is accessible on all Fortnite Festival songs , with new tracks releasing every week since its release. Fortnite Festival ’s new update will release on May 24, alongside the new Chapter 5 Season 3.

item.title: Atari Acquires Former Longtime Rival
item.description:
Highlights

  • Atari acquires the Intellivision brand and 200 games.
  • Atari will now distribute Intellivision titles both digitally and physically.

Atari has recently acquired the Intellivision brand name for an undisclosed amount, gaining control over more than 200 games from Intellivision LLC. Atari and Intellivision were rivals during the 70s and 80s and featured among the first console manufacturers in the United States.

Atari is widely known for successful consoles such as the Atari 2600 , which was released in 1979 and had fairly big hits such as Pac-Man , Space Invaders , Donkey Kong , Pitfall , and Frogger . One of its main rivals was the Intellivision console, which launched in the same year. Both brands struggled to remain as driving forces in the console market from the late 80s onwards, but Atari has been having a renaissance recently based on nostalgia over its old IPs.

Related
Best Atari Jaguar Games, Ranked

Even though the Atari Jaguar is now just a memory, it's still worth remembering some of the best games the console witnessed.

Now, Atari has officially purchased the Intellivision brand name, as well as the license for over 200 games from Intellivision LLC, according to Games Industry.biz . While not many details of the deal were revealed, including an exact list of games and the money spent in the acquisition, it was confirmed that Atari will distribute Intellivision titles both digitally and physically. The company is set to explore Intellivision’s previous licenses, even “potentially creating new games” based on them. Intellivision LLC will continue to develop its recent Amico console, though, which was not part of the deal. Atari’s CEO Wade Rosen talked about the acquisition, calling it a “very rare opportunity to unite former competitors.”

It was already known that Intellivision was struggling. The company had its Amico console originally set to be released in 2020, but the launch has suffered several delays due to issues related to its production. Back in 2022, Intellivision’s CEO Tommy Talarico stepped down .

Atari Is Leveraging Decades of Nostalgia With New Releases

This acquisition is the latest major move from Atari, which has been having a sort of renaissance recently. Last year, Atari released The Making of Karateka , which was widely praised as one of the best video game museums due to how it used archival materials and video features to explain how the classic game was made.

So far, it seems that Atari’s moves towards leveraging its brands using nostalgia are working very well. Last month, for instance, Atari announced that it would bring back the classic Infogrames publishing label . Infogrames will now act as a new publishing label under Atari, and it will focus on releasing titles that are not part of Atari’s “core intellectual properties.”
